groups.name: Content
groups.description: Requirements related to the substantive content of the articles.

requirements.description: An article should start with a clear definition in the lead section.
requirements.reference: The first sentence of the lead should define what the scope of the article is.

requirements.description: The article should include a section on the gene's function.
requirements.reference: A section detailing the gene's function should be included.

requirements.description: Include information on the gene's location on the chromosome.
requirements.reference: The gene's chromosomal location should be mentioned.
requirements.when: Applicable when chromosomal location is known.

requirements.description: Discuss known mutations and their effects.
requirements.reference: Information on known mutations and their effects should be included.

requirements.description: Include a section on the gene's evolutionary history.
requirements.reference: A section on the evolutionary history of the gene is recommended.
requirements.when: Applicable when evolutionary history is relevant.

groups.name: Formatting
groups.description: Requirements related to the formatting of the articles.

requirements.description: Use the infobox template for genes and proteins.
requirements.reference: The infobox template should be used for genes and proteins.

requirements.description: Ensure consistent use of headings and subheadings.
requirements.reference: Headings and subheadings should be used consistently throughout the article.

requirements.description: Use bullet points for lists where appropriate.
requirements.reference: Bullet points should be used for lists where appropriate.

groups.name: Language Usage
groups.description: Guidelines for the appropriate use of language, including gene nomenclature and abbreviations.

requirements.description: Human gene names should be written in all capitals.
requirements.reference: Human gene names are written in capitals, for example ALDOA, INS, etc.

requirements.description: Avoid jargon and explain technical terms.
requirements.reference: Jargon should be avoided and technical terms should be explained.

groups.name: Citations
groups.description: Requirements related to the citation of sources in the articles.

requirements.description: Cite reliable sources for all claims.
requirements.reference: All claims should be supported by citations from reliable sources.

requirements.description: Use inline citations for specific statements.
requirements.reference: Inline citations should be used for specific statements.

requirements.description: Prefer recent sources for current information.
requirements.reference: Recent sources should be preferred for current information.

groups.name: Structure
groups.description: Requirements related to the structural organization of the articles.

requirements.reference: The recommended article structure should be followed.

requirements.description: Include a lead section summarizing the article.
requirements.reference: A lead section summarizing the article should be included.

requirements.description: Use sections to organize content logically.
requirements.reference: Sections should be used to organize content logically.
